column4: I installed ubunutu earlier. I installed ati drivers a few minutes ago...it won't let me get my screen resolution higher then 1024x768. but everything looks choppy, and kinda blurry. how do I fix this?
Any ideas?
O
I'm also new to IRC...lol can ya'll see what Im typing or not?
lol
How come I can't change screen reso higher then 1024x768? My reso is too big and everything is choppy/blurry.
you can add extra resolutions manualy by editing  xorg.conf
: How do I edit the xorg.conf?
gksu gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
I added it, and it didn't show up in Screen Resolution.
you may have to restart X
hold on
be patient with me I,m helping in 3 windows
your problem is just that you need to adjust the horizsync setting in xorg.conf,  that is common with crt screens,   edit xorg.conf again find the correct line and make the ranage  ??-70
did you get my last msg ?
I am in the Ubuntu Recovery Mode. What shall I type to edit the xorg.conf
sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf

In xorg.conf, I have like a ton 4 or 5 lines that say subection "Display" then two lines under it, then EndSubsecion, and then another sbsection display, etc. Isnt there only suppose to be 1 Subsection Display?
look for horizsynk     23-56 or whastever the numbers are  change it to **-70  ( ** means leave those numbers as is )
Okay, how do I save ths file and reboot?
I have no idea how to sayve in nano
